meta.description: The annual survey about the current State of JavaScript

welcome_screens.title:
Thanks for taking this survey! Together, maybe we'll be able to figure out this JavaScript thing once and for all!

Also, we know this survey seems long, but it's mostly the same questions repeated for different frameworks and libraries. Most people only take around *15 minutes* to fill it in.

thankyou_screens.title:
Thanks for completing this typeform
Now *create your own* â€” it's free, easy, & beautiful

properties.description: How long you've been writing JavaScript.

choices.label: Front-end Developer/Engineer
Full-stack Developer/Engineer

properties.description: How do you introduce yourself at parties?

choices.label: Level 1: virtually no knowledge of CSS
Level 2: using CSS frameworks and tweaking existing styles
Level 3: knowing specificity rules, being able to create layouts
Level 4: mastering animations, interactions, transitions, etc.
Level 5: being able to style an entire front-end from scratch following a consistent methodology

properties.description: How proficient are you at writing CSS? (pick the most advanced option corresponding to your skills)

choices.label: Level 1: not able to handle any back-end work
Level 2: able to set up all-in-one CMSs (WordPress, etc.) or static site generators (Jekyll, etc.)
Level 3: able to develop apps using pre-existing frameworks (Rails, Laravel, etc.)
Level 4: setting up an entire back-end from scratch (Go, Node, etc.)
Level 5: able to handle complex multi-server or microservices architectures

properties.description: How proficient are you at back-end development? (pick the most advanced option corresponding to your skills)
